title: Grade 2
subject: Extended Content Standards For English Language Arts (2017-)

document.title: North Carolina EXTENDED CONTENT STANDARDS English Language Arts K-12

914F679B8E174E62B0861E83628BA477.description: Use words acquired through conversations, being read to, and during shared reading activities.

D0E47EEC7CAD4BEBA5B8754A3A73C3DE.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.6 – Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for
reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in developing vocabulary
knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

9E5E95BE8371407EB8A61F5E514E31BB.description: Demonstrate understanding of the meaning of commonly occurring verbs.

E4B2A572B7FC4F05B7DFF3DAAE440369.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and use.

43BB79C3662A445C85181A641C6773D7.description: CCR Anchor Standard L.5 – Demonstrate understanding of figurative language and nuances in word meanings.

79DF0F470D1146D4A95AEC8709AAAFCD.description: Demonstrate knowledge of word meanings drawn from grade 2 content.

07B56633621140BD9858F2F458C9B60D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.4 – Determine and clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context
clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

B96F5AC051B0446586CC8FC10AEDBAAC.description: Use symbolic language to achieve desired outcomes when communicating.

C42068C54BE04D338F89C5C0E79AE389.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.3 – Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective
choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully reading or listening.

ECB256A49FAA42FDB0F5262233ADDFA7.description: Demonstrate emerging understanding of conventions of standard English during shared writing within 2-3 conventions continuum when writing.

2DB301A146164DFB949B0C270B2CF284.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.2 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when
writing; demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band conventions continuum.

7BCC8FF0D74D4608B9C10C6D2884A3C4.description: Demonstrate understanding of letter and word use within the 2-3 grammar continuum when writing or communicating.

F5EE75800DE4419B96CA1AD734087CBB.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.1 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking;
demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band grammar continuum.

A67F142026374059AB68176D64E5A874.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.6 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

5BC7B6265E8441F99DFE72F346D3201D.description: Select visual, audio, or tactual representations that support communication about a personal experience.

6FA31FF57F8F419D95519562DBD01588.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.5 – Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance
understanding of presentations.

36BE0EA899AA4E209A6FC0669936599F.description: Communicate about a personal experience or event.

857587ADC5DC4C52B2BE6DEE1F35A4EE.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.4 – Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning
and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

1A2D303782AF4823BE992F7D59B69DF6.description: Answer who and what questions about the details provided by the speaker.

6E02FA6EC4204CE6AA5525EDCFC83E46.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.3 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

E4CCD3D5A5654990B9BF4B51BBE091B5.description: During shared reading, answer who and what questions.

847542332B3840E6B9A81881C02A506C.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.2 – Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively,
and orally.

B03CF8DCFB034200B82E0EA21DCE1169.description: Ask for clarification and further explanation as needed about the topics and texts under discussion.

35FB912EFB4E438BAB6F613F762D5278.description: Build on others’ talk in conversations by linking their comments to the remarks of others.

C83F395670E04DB18A374E11BC333E65.description: Engage in multiple-turn exchanges with peers with support from an adult.

ED48B00F55324F74ABFCCDF77AE40348.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.1 – Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners,
building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

6D1A7D44D32B416195796FBAE31C565C.description: Integrated into Standards W.1, W.2, and W.3

663DE1BE300C4C53BA68BE9BF08DE7DA.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.10 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

19DA5D3FFF7048418169716548F074C5.description: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

D28741DBFE554CEB935DFC329650D87B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.9 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research. Proposed: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

60CA0DA02C644BD297E5BE19CA738CBC.description: Identify information related to personal experiences and answer simple questions about those experiences.

6912BE830CAD4A0F822F680907E36F55.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.6 (from Proposed Standards – was W.8 in 2010 Standards) – Gather relevant information from multiple print and
digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

532B6A8EA43F4A7C8BDB0389AB81606C.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects.

2FFDC56524B643E99CC9C1534E33A72D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.5 (from Proposed Standards – was W.7 in 2010 Standards) – Conduct short as well as more sustained research
projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

19CF1AA44A2E4DDC8A1C97FBA3D1DF6E.description: With guidance and support from adults and peers, use digital tools to produce and publish writing.

A5FA7C2CC04F45D2A4AAF02844D6D723.description: CR Anchor Standard W.4: Use digital tools and resources to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

01D89AE48D334F62A5A28E3A8F36E805.description: Select an event or personal experience and use drawing, writing, or dictating to compose a message about it.

5067B2EE1AB64A5680EC83576EF2F094.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.3 – Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen
details, and well-structured event sequences.

7E02D7A458574C5AACC2C5AE7A8BA062.description: Select a topic and use drawing, dictating, or writing to create a written product with one or more facts about the topic.

7998B44A5F8148109262FFDC19A3C7DF.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.2 – Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and
accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

F0732322E30746F499DD5D4BAD90C0F9.description: Select a topic and use drawing, dictating, or writing to state an opinion about it.

BA99A12D024C434E90AC6DE107E35F1D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.1 – Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and
relevant and sufficient evidence.

980261B8D7E64E06948542CD853C843E.description: Engage in purposeful reading of familiar text." a. Read familiar text comprised of known words.

C45EF4D422334C9C8F6230FE43F6CC6D.description: Identify letter sound correspondence for single consonants.

E438C117D4E344158132F9EDE9FC8500.description: Identify the lower case letters of the alphabet.

B0AC4EB750234E0EB39067595A7553F5.description: Demonstrate emerging use of letter-sound knowledge to read words.

B28900C510EC443A9C116109FD7F8333.description: Selects or produces letters when asked to write."

E7327CFED76C47488ACF48920A3840AF.description: Actively engage in group reading of information text for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to text.

ADFD24451FD74C03BE030B4A9D8C1895.description:
CR Anchor Standard RI.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting prior
knowledge and experiences to text.

23538C4712A94541B1A66132A458C158.description: Identify a common element between two texts on the same topic.

DB292782198043FE84A2C812C6C5A99B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare
the approaches the authors take.

B10BC2F7999E4D26825A8F45FFBBEF8E.description: Identify points an author makes in a familiar informational text."

E11AF016BCBC4AF791B9D334C85D1FDC.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

659AFD51E34B49F88277C488ED5B6E2F.description: Identify images, objects, or tactuals that illustrate key ideas in a text.

24CBD1D478AD48AAA924AA806C7D32A6.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

08246FB2D3B747E4B056C21E83D97460.description: Identify the purpose of the author and the illustrator.

BE25A5AF966642B08C64FFE4010DFBA2.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.6: Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

1C87325B6D2C4B0FAC69E8BDD2282A4E.description: Locate key facts or information in a familiar text."

7E8CF32EEAC6434383A8C5B5B1957B42.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

51B3DC8C09244AE492BA9251E35A4EB3.description: Identify words that relate to the topic of a text.

6CDBE103DCBA45C2BADC788D1E8DD8B1.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning
or tone.

C8887730B99A4677907A668BD400E90E.description: Identify individuals, events, or details in an informational text.

F816438347D343C2B1096A75AD1B3665.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.3 – Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

8C031A9563614FC286620AB154A36B06.description: identify the main topic of text.

C670B04573C64CF59EECB3E4A5E6A306.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.2 – Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

9DBB779321B84BBB938AF8D496210CDE.description: Answer who and what, where questions to demonstrate understanding of details in a familiar text.

73429BBC2D204B558BA65955E7E35F65.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

A08DF95F93F3474C931B8ECAA2610E92.description: Actively engage in group reading for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to text

B3FA4E4849084018BE01821864342DD1.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting
prior knowledge and experiences to text.

BE0F449DBCA24848A4B2130B07FC833C.description: Identify similarities between two versions of the same story.

81F56528110B45328F2EC600B71DF3A9.description:
CCRAnchorStandardRL.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the
approaches the authors take.

DA49AE0DA29D4BB5BB27FD4308D8A7C7.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

D31E3DBE50A841B48B4E3724E3F699E0.description: Identify illustrations or objects/tactual information in print or digital text that depict characters.

CD5549C0E27848ABB05DC65A9C49457C.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

41F92870AFEA48EAB0C61BF2AC8C0F43.description: Identify the speakers in a dialogue.

E8F01A81B25240D3A052696EEEA24F5F.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.6 Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

EE4A2FDE9B3247369141CB11E47DE99B.description: Determine the beginning and ending of a familiar story with a logical order.

123BBAF11BB24D2B868EC8C0E4EDB2E6.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

91D5A22DA8214A03AC123F777D94EE83.description: Use rhyming or repetition to identify words that meaningfully complete a line in a familiar story, poem, or song.

92D5BD7D30E3497FB1868A26FA0182FD.description: RL.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

BA6F862D13074DCF911C9D258B37EAEB.description: Identify the actions of the characters in a story.

2DEE7C462D484B409BCF452E42C11F45.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.3 –Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

0B322157BE1D4909AD27C011D3AC7D59.description: Recount events from familiar stories from diverse cultures.

775DD6111EA44345830B9B4EA3E6502A.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.2 –Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

9A21ADEFEF094DCEB029E0D4E129B2E9.description: Answer who and what, where, questions to demonstrate understanding of details in a familiar text.

D1DB45F02467427F9E9FC4CD084D7C9A.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
